li.a: New Bremen Junior High & High School (7-12)

div.span: How COVID-19 affects New Bremen Schools

li.a: New Bremen Junior High & High School (7-12)

img.style: width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

img.alt: football team huddled together in red uniforms
students smiling and raising hands in hallway

td.span: A member of the MAC Athletic League in west-central Ohio, New Bremen offers student-athletes a wide range of sports for a school our size and in one of the best small-school conferences in Ohio

Students at New Bremen Schools consistently perform at an Excellent level. With outstanding teachers, programs and technology, our students not only succeed on standardized tests, but are also substantially prepared for college or the work force.

The New Bremen community is a great place to live, not to mention a fantastic place to go to school. Located at the summit of the Miami-Erie Canal and with many dining and entertainment options, our small town is a wonderful place to call home.

div.span: Remote learning for the remainder of this school year

br.span: Today, Governor DeWine extended remote learning through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Therefore, remote learning will continue through Monday, May 11th. If you have any questions, please feel free to submit them using our COVID-19 page located by clicking here.

div.span: Remote Spirit Week
Remote Learning Extended Until At Least May 1, 2020

br.span: Governor Mike DeWine extended K-12 school closures until at least May 1st. New Bremen Schools will continue to provide remote learning during this period of time. Teachers are currently in the process of planning lessons for students that may include online, paper-pencil, or a combination depending on the student’s accessibility to technology. Additional information will be communicated soon regarding dates, times, and methods for students and parents to safely pick up additional paper-pencil lessons. If you have any questions, please feel free to submit a question using the coronavirus page located here.

div.span: Ohio's Stay At Home Order

span.div: The Ohio Department of Health issued a Stay at Home Order for non-essential travel on Sunday. The Order does allow for educational travel to maintain remote education operations and meals for eligible students. The District plans to continue providing remote education and meal services unless directed otherwise by State or local agencies.

div.br: Therefore, the drop box and material exchange set-up at the high school and elementary will continue to be open. We will be cleaning the drop-off areas multiple times per day and encourage you to use the hand sanitizer we have provided at each location. If you are not comfortable with dropping materials off you may scan or take a picture of the materials and email them directly to the teacher.
If you have any questions regarding District operations, please feel free to email us using the question box on the District coronavirus operations webpage.

div.style: float:left; width:100%; margin-top:30px; border-left:1px solid #CFCFCF; padding:0 25px;

li.a: How COVID-19 affects New Bremen Schools
How COVID-19 affects New Bremen Schools

div.span: Information on COVID-19 (coronavirus) as it relates to New Bremen Schools

span.div: New Bremen Schools is closely monitoring reports about the coronavirus (COVID-19) cases being reported across Ohio. We are committed to following all guidance from local, state, and federal health experts for K-12 schools in its response to COVID-19.

div.span: Remote Learning Extended Until At Least May 1st

Governor Mike DeWine extended K-12 school closures until at least May 1st. New Bremen Schools will continue to provide remote learning during this period of time. Teachers are currently in the process of planning lessons for students that may include online, paper-pencil, or a combination depending on the student’s accessibility to technology.
K-6 Assignment Pickup Dates/Times

span.div: Teachers have been busy preparing assignments for your children to work on over the next few weeks. For students in grades K-6, assignment packets can be picked up from the elementary office on Thursday, April 2nd from 3:00PM - 7:00PM or Friday, April 3rd from 9:00AM – 2:00PM. Assignments will be issued in a manner supporting physical distancing.
If you are unable to pick up assignments during these scheduled times, please call the elementary office to make other arrangements.

div.span: Questions or concerns?

div.h3: Who can I contact for more information?

span.div: If you need a question answered, please use the form below. Your question(s) will automatically be forwarded to the following people:
Jason Schrader - Superintendent
Diane Kramer - K-6 Principal
Marcus Overman - 7-12 Principal
Gary Jones - Athletic Director
Chad Wells - Athletic Director

div.span: Ohio's Stay At Home Order

The Ohio Department of Health issued a Stay at Home Order for non-essential travel on Sunday. The Order does allow for educational travel to maintain remote education operations and meals for eligible students. The District plans to continue providing remote education and meal services unless directed otherwise by State or local agencies.
Therefore, the drop box and material exchange set-up at the high school and elementary will continue to be open. We will be cleaning the drop-off areas multiple times per day and encourage you to use the hand sanitizer we have provided at each location. If you are not comfortable with dropping materials off you may scan or take a picture of the materials and email them directly to the teacher.
If you have any questions regarding District operations, please feel free to email us using the question box below.
Parents of students receiving school-based physical and occupational therapy services

New Bremen Local Schools wants to make sure your child is receiving the necessary therapy and special services to meet his/her ongoing educational needs during this closure of schools. In order to continue to provide as much support as possible to you and your student during this very unusual time, we are going to offer virtual therapy sessions on-line. Therapy staff will be reaching out to families to obtain consent for such services and to receive and share the necessary information for setting up the virtual on-line sessions. We look forward to talking to you and interacting with your student! Be safe and stay healthy! The therapy staff from the Community Sports and Therapy Center
What is Cancelled?

span.div: Kindergarten screening is being cancelled for this year and will not be rescheduled. More information for parents who will have a kindergarten child next year can be found at the bottom of this page - please scroll down.

All New Bremen buildings and athletic facilities, both indoor and outdoor, are closed to everyone. Students and coaches are not permitted to use any of our facilities, even on their own. This is a mandate from the OHSAA. In addition, our buildings are closed to the public. Our school offices are open during normal school hours, but by appointment only. Please call your school office to set up an appointment, if needed.
The community mulch fundraiser will be canceled for this year. Thank you for your understanding and we hope you will participate again in the spring of 2021

Athletic Physicals that were scheduled for May 6th will be postponed until later in the summer. Tentatively, we are looking at July 7, 8 or 9 as possible dates. We need to check with all involved to see if any of these dates will work and will provide more information as that time approaches.

Per the OHSAA, all practices are cancelled for all sports from March 16, 2020 and through at least May 1, 2020. At New Bremen, all of our athletic facilities will be shut down during this time. This includes our CBC training facility, track, baseball and softball fields and gyms. The OHSAA considers this time a mandatory no-contact period.

Per the OHSAA, all athletic contests scheduled for play from March 16, 2020 and through at least May 1, 2020 are cancelled. The OHSAA considers this time a mandatory no-contact period for coaches. The OHSAA will then require a mandatory acclamation period.
All field trips and after-school events are cancelled from March 16, 2020 and through at least May 1, 2020.

div.strong: James F Dicke Performance Arts Center

span.div: All performances scheduled in our James F Dicke Performing Arts Center from March 16, 2020 and through at least May 1, 2020 are cancelled. This includes any performance through the Lock One Community Arts and the Crescent Players.

Our CBC Facility will be closed to everyone, including our community members, until at least May 1, 2020. We will extend each community member's renewal date by the same number of days that we close this facility.
The delivery of the Winner’s Meats fundraiser will not take place on April 7th as originally scheduled. A new delivery date is yet to be determined.

div.span: Kindergarten Screening Forms

span.div: Due to circumstances beyond all of our control, we will not be holding in-person Kindergarten Screening this year.

div.strong: Parents that have children that will be attending kindergarten next school year (2020-2021):

span.div: While we will not hold screening as we traditionally do, there is still much information we need to gather from parents. Please use the link below to download a packet of forms that are necessary to enroll your child in Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year.

Please download, print and complete these forms. (These forms cannot be filled out electronically.) In addition to these forms, a copy of your child’s immunization record and birth certificate must also be submitted.
After completing these forms, you can submit them back to school by one of these three methods:
1. By emailing them to NBKindergarten@newbremenschools.org. (Feel free to scan them, if you have the means, or take a picture of them with a phone or tablet.)
2. By dropping off the forms at the elementary buiding Monday-Friday, from 8:00AM to 3:00PM. A drop box, labeled "Kindergarten Forms" will be located in the lobby.
3. By mailing them to:
New Bremen Elementary School
Attn: Diane Kramer, Elementary Principal
202-210 S. Walnut St. New Bremen, OH 45869

strong.em: All of this completed paperwork needs to be e-mailed, dropped off at school or returned by mail no later than April 15th.

span.strong: Click here to download the packet of forms

div.span: Initial Press Release on Remote Learning

div.h3: The following information was our initial press release for school closure and remote learning

span.div: On March 12, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine ordered all K-12 schools in Ohio closed for three weeks to help slow down the spread of Coronavirus (COVID-19). As a result, New Bremen Schools will be closed beginning Tuesday, March 17, 2020 through at least Friday, April 3, 2020. This is an unprecedented move by the governor but one the district has been planning for throughout the week.

Part of our responsibility is to continue the education of our students when school is cancelled for an extended period of time beyond our traditional calamity and make-up days. The intention for contiuing education is not to burden students and parents with additional responsibilities but rather practice skills students are capable of demostrating so that they retain academic knowledge. What this looks like depends on the age/grade level and types of courses each student is taking this semester. Possible lessons assigned by your child's teacher may include online, paper-pencil, or a combination, depending on the student's accessibility to technology. Teachers will be communicating with students and parents on ways we can all help to preserve the continuity of education during the school closure.

Please understand that we are constantly receiving new information and we will continue to work out many details regarding the school closure. Our number one responsibility is the safety of our students and community.
We are working with our local and state health departments, and using the information from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) as our guidance.

We will keep you up to date through our OneCall Now notification system and by posting information on this website and our social media platforms. If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us.

div.span: What's Cancelled?

We are posting, to this page, all the events, including athletic events, that we are cancelling. You can find this list of cancellations on this page, but you may need to scroll up or down (depending on the device you are using) to find it.
Student & Parent Resources
Tips from 7-12 Principal Marcus Overman on making online learning successful

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'How to Talk to Your Children About Conoravirus');

div.a: How to Talk to Your Children About Conoravirus

div.span: Here are some basic do's and don'ts from K-6 Principal, Diane Kramer and School Psychologist, Lauren LInk, about talking with your children about the Coronavirus.
Drop Boxes for Returning Work

span.div: Students have been given work to complete during this time. Drop boxes have been set up for students to use to return that work as needed.
Elementary Office for K-8 students
High School Office for 9-12 students

div.strong: These Drop Boxes will be available:

span.div: Mon, Wed, Fri from 8AM to 3PM.
Tues, Thurs from 8AM to 6PM

div.span: School Lunch Information

New Bremen Schools will continue to offer lunches to our students who participate in the National School Lunch Program. These students have been contacted by school personnel. If you would like more information about this, please call your school office or email your school principal using the form on this page.
COVID-19 Resources
